poem:
Title: "Upon Reading of Russell Brand's Baptism"

Brand's sins, like mayflies, simply swept away,
On Thames' banks where holy waters drench, 
Yet, the skeptics tower over the fray,
Balancing belief on doubt's delicate bench.
A ritual, a rite, perhaps mere show,
Or sanctifying in life's ceaseless flow.
With every wave, we seek our own absolve,
In each baptism, a mystery to solve.
